parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate.  It discusses Saint Andrew, a religious figure, and his life. There is no mention of any political candidate or party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The content is not a private message or personal communication.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to provide information about Saint Andrew. There is no attempt to influence voters' choices in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be considered a form of religious or historical information dissemination, similar to a journalistic approach of presenting factual information. It does not advocate for or against any political candidate or party.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion related to the parliamentary elections. It presents historical and religious information about Saint Andrew.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>928512272563505</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post discusses Saint Andrew, a religious figure, and does not mention any political candidate or party participating in the parliamentary elections. The post's objective is to provide information, not to influence voters.  While it's a paid advertisement reaching a wide audience, the content itself is unrelated to the electoral process.  Therefore, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 and Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Răzvan Biro</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
